alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:14PM CST until January 30 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Brazos River near US-59, Sugarland affecting Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria and Fort Bend. * WHEN...Until Monday. * IMPACTS...At 67.5 feet, Minor flooding continues as Baudet Road has close to one foot of water over the road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 912 PM CST, the stage was 65.1 feet. Flood stage is 65.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 40.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the last 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM CST Friday was 65.1. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 67.4 feet by Saturday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage on Monday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
